title: How to Clean Breast Pump Tubing

steps.title: Remove the tubing from the breast pump.
steps.content: Remove the tubing from the breast pump. Turn off the breast pump and unplug it from the power source. Disconnect the tubing from the breast shields. [1] X Trustworthy Source Michigan Medicine The University of Michigan's medical center, which provides patient care, supports research, and educates the public on health topics Go to source Refer to the manufacturer's instructions if you are unsure how to remove the tubing.

steps.title: Rinse the tubing under running water.
steps.content: Rinse the tubing under running water. Place the tubing in a sink or basin. Run water through the tubing to help remove residue. Keep rinsing until all the milk is gone. [2] X Trustworthy Source Michigan Medicine The University of Michigan's medical center, which provides patient care, supports research, and educates the public on health topics Go to source

steps.title: Soak the tubing in warm, soapy water.
steps.content: Soak the tubing in warm, soapy water. Fill the basin or sink with warm water and a few squirts of dish soap. Choose a mild dish soap without added moisturizers, or pick one formulated specifically for cleaning baby bottles, cups, and toys. Let the tubing soak for 2-3 minutes. [3] X Trustworthy Source Michigan Medicine The University of Michigan's medical center, which provides patient care, supports research, and educates the public on health topics Go to source

steps.title: Rinse it thoroughly with warm, running water.
steps.content: Rinse it thoroughly with warm, running water. Hold the tubing under warm running water to remove the soap. Rinse it out several times, letting the water run through the tubing for 10-15 seconds. [4] X Trustworthy Source US Food and Drug Administration U.S. government agency responsible for promoting public health Go to source Make sure there is no more soap left in the tubing before you set it aside to dry.

steps.title: Put the tubing in boiling water for a thorough sterilization.
steps.content: Put the tubing in boiling water for a thorough sterilization. Let the tubing sit in a pot of boiling water for 5 minutes. Do not add soap or cleaners to the water, as this can get into the tubing. [5] X Trustworthy Source Michigan Medicine The University of Michigan's medical center, which provides patient care, supports research, and educates the public on health topics Go to source

steps.title: Use the dishwasher for a quick and easy option.
steps.content: Use the dishwasher for a quick and easy option. Put the tubing on the top rack of the dishwasher and run the dishwasher on the hot water cycle as well as the heat drying cycle. The heat in the dishwasher will kill any bacteria or germs. [6] X Trustworthy Source Michigan Medicine The University of Michigan's medical center, which provides patient care, supports research, and educates the public on health topics Go to source Make sure the tubing is dishwasher safe.

steps.title: Sterilize the tubing in the microwave if you're in a pinch.
steps.content: Sterilize the tubing in the microwave if you're in a pinch. Some breast pump tubing comes with a microwavable bag you can use to sterilize it. Fill the bag with a few inches of water and place the tubing in the bag. Then, seal the bag shut. Put the bag in the microwave and run it on high for 3 minutes. [7] X Trustworthy Source Michigan Medicine The University of Michigan's medical center, which provides patient care, supports research, and educates the public on health topics Go to source Follow the manufacturer's instructions on the back of the bag to ensure you use it correctly. Keep in mind microwaveable bags do not meet FDA standards for sterilization, but they can be used if you are in a hurry.

steps.title: Hang the tubing to let it air dry.
steps.content: Hang the tubing to let it air dry. Drape the tubing over your dish rack or drying rack so it can air dry. Make sure the tubing is not touching any other items and the ends are open to allow air to flow through the tubing. [8] X Trustworthy Source Michigan Medicine The University of Michigan's medical center, which provides patient care, supports research, and educates the public on health topics Go to source

steps.title: Let the tubing dry flat on a dishtowel if you have more time.
steps.content: Let the tubing dry flat on a dishtowel if you have more time. Another option is to lay the tubing flat on a clean dishtowel so it can dry overnight. The tubing will take longer to dry, perhaps between 8-12 hours. [9] X Trustworthy Source US Food and Drug Administration U.S. government agency responsible for promoting public health Go to source

steps.title: Attach the tubing to the pump and run it for 3-4 minutes to dry it quickly.
steps.content: Attach the tubing to the pump and run it for 3-4 minutes to dry it quickly. To ensure the tubing is completely dry inside, attach it to the pump on one side and turn on the pump. Run the pump for several minutes to help dry any water or condensation in the tube. [10] X Trustworthy Source Michigan Medicine The University of Michigan's medical center, which provides patient care, supports research, and educates the public on health topics Go to source You can also leave the pump running for a few minutes after you are done using it to help remove condensation. This will make cleaning the tubing easier.

steps.title: Store the tubing with the other pump parts once it has dried completely.
steps.content: Store the tubing with the other pump parts once it has dried completely. Do not store the tubing while it is still wet, as this can allow bacteria and mold to form. Let it dry completely and then keep it with the other parts of the breast pump so the pump is easy to put together as needed.
